author: Bleather
title: Excellent Care - NHS Fife Dietetic-Led IBS Service
body:
I requested to be referred to the Dietetic-Led IBS Service as I was having a lot of problems with my IBS symptoms. I had been recently diagnosed with the Exocrine Pancreatic Insufficiency (EPI) condition and put on enzymes replacement therapy by my GP.  
The dietician was amazing, a good listener and very supportive. He advised as a starting point to increase the enzymes and explained how they worked including when to increase them for example when eating a big meal. He also put me on a tablet that helped with the acid build. I almost instantly saw a difference in my condition and had less acid build up which had stopped me sleeping well and made my thirsty all the time.  
I still had some IBS symptoms so the next step was to cut out wheat for 2 weeks. This was the main turning point for me as my IBS symptoms disappeared within 24 hours.  
I have been discharged from this service as a pain free, happier, less stressed person who can do the normal things including not needing to find rest rooms in a hurry which was very stressful. Another benefit with using this service it has helped me to stay away from my GP and other health professionals as I am now feeling well and hardly have any IBS symptoms. I also have a better understanding of EPI and IBS and feel confident in managing my own symptoms. Please can you thank the dietician on my behalf?

author: Stewe96
title: This officer is gifted and very talented
body:
I was around A/E and my mother was receiving treatment. We was next to a room and I saw this security officer really take charge and handle a mental health situation with care. This officer had the best approach because it can easily go left. Everything was under control and the patient respected him.  
I just wanna share this story because I know how high mental health was and this officer is gifted and very talented. We need him around more, we need role models like this who never hide their skills.  
Thank you to the trust for having a individual like this around in a busy department. That really made my day and put a smile on my face even tho I was feeling down.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

author: MK77
title: I was desperate for investigation and treatment
body:
I am writing to log the Complainant about the time I have been in Mayday A&E department and seen by very rude and unvarying Doctors .  
On Sunday evening I went to A&E due severe abdomen pain, I have been seen by doctor after 5 hours long waiting .  
First Doctor was fantastic. They had made a plan of proper treatment and investigation, unfortunately their shift got changed and the doctor who has took over have cancelled all plan and have told me according to them I have some stone in kidney due that was pain. The doctor will treat as UTI (Urinary Tract Infection) and advices me: please take this antibiotic and go home, keep taking a pain killers because nothing else I can do or see afterwards your GP.  
If my GP were very helpful I wouldn’t have gone to A&E, I was desperate for investigation and treatment .  
I was left without option and I went home. The doctor didn’t took into consideration my diagnosis and how much I am exposed on risk due my diagnosis one of them is Lupus, also in discharge summary has written that they have given me oral IV (Intravenous) fluids which I have never received.  
I was four days at home and my condition didn’t improve, even I have completed the course of the medication, then that night I went to A&E once more .  
While booking my condition and informing of my pain level, no one took into consideration offering pain killer or seeing me earlier. I have seen people comes after myself and seen before me. Eventually Doctor called me after 5 hours long waiting, I was shocked of their behaviour and words, I found them extremely rude!  
The doctor have told me why I have come back to A&E? that is only for emergency and I should of gone to GP!  
First full I have right of treatment, secondary the doctor shouldn’t spoken to me such a words or on that level. Instead of being carefully looking into my history of illness, diagnosis and present issue why I am at A&E and instead they should try to help me. The doctor was so rude and unhelpful to me. Most people who go to hospital especially A&E have something very painful, and I was not the only case. There was group of people which was experiencing same situations as me from same doctor, whoever the doctor seen doesn’t spend with the patient more than 5 minutes!  
Unfortunately this website doesn’t allow to mention other people's names, otherwise surely I would mention the cases and names who there was sharing same experience as me.  
I am raising this complaint not because NHS is a bad system but to ensure that someone senior on board to overlook what was going on during the patients time in the hospital.  
If each of them has been attended on time and treated as soon as he was seen.  
Some patients who require blood test investigation need to be seen first and possibly explained that lab might take up to 1-2 hours for their results in order to make correct treatment.  
I hope this will be noted and dealt with professionally. Should you require information about the above mentioned patients, it can be provided on your request so you can check your data records.

author: Rhonda77
title: I know they're busy but nobody called back!
body:
I had a letter saying after 6 months on the waiting list I could have some Physio on my knee , I phoned the number on the letter at my local hospital 2/3 times and no reply only a answerphone. I know they're busy but nobody called back! I phoned during their working times of 8-4pm and later, no reply!  
I got a generic letter today saying if I don’t call soon I will be taken off their list! 😭 but nobody has called or left a message with me so how am I supposed to contact them? Terrible service and very dissatisfied.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Someone12
title: A repeated prescription
body:
I am an asthmatic person, and in the same time I have 3 children.  
For 6 days I had an asthma attack. That was when I contacted my GP for a new inhaler because I had nothing left in my inhaler. When I called it was after 12pm and the recipient said they have no available appointments and I need to fill an online form (which usually take 48 hours for a prescription to be ready for collection). They said they will try for it to be ready as soon as possible.  
By the end of the day, I heard nothing from them. When it was about 12 am I couldn't handle the asthma anymore + I was a bit worried about what would happen if I needed it during my sleep. For the 5 nights before, I woke up during sleep with shortness of breath, so I called 111 which were so helpful. They ended up sending a taxi to pick me up. They asked for a covid rapid test which became positive, and they saw me directly and give me an inhaler after checking me. (I wish if knew the doctor's name so I can mention his name for being a real good doctor)  
So I went back home, and I was expecting maybe the next day I would receive a new prescription from my GP (which I didn't really want to go and collect because I already had a new inhaler) and if I didn't, I was guessing I would receive the new prescription on Monday. I didn't expect that I would receive a SMS the following day, saying I had requested salbutamol only 2 weeks after my last prescription was issued and suggesting I am overusing this medication. It said one inhaler should last around 6 months. and they were not issuing another inhaler. I was advised that if I felt unwell please give them a call today, and to make a nurse appointment for an asthma review.  
*They refused to write a new prescription because my last prescription was before 2 weeks (which I don't think is true, but I think that it was more than 3 weeks). **They asked me to call and make an appointment (which I wasn't able to do the same day because it was already the afternoon, but I would need to wait until after the weekend and call before 11am - maybe I will get an appointment).***they didn't seem to think about what if I had a really bad asthma attack. What would have happened for myself and my kids if I have no inhaler at home. They could write a one inhaler prescription and send me an appointment or tell me that I need to make an appointment or they will not be able to help me next time I need new one. I was just lucky because the emergency doctor assisted to see me and checked on me and he gave me the medication I really needed.

author: Bethan Sings
title: hystoroscopy clinic Lincoln
body:
I would just like to give feedback for Jackie, Ania, and Nicky who made, what would be a horrible experience, a genuinely positive one. Although there was pain in my procedure (unavoidable) the ladies demonstrated true care, humour and patience towards me so that I felt really safe and comfortable. We were singing songs and laughing and it was such a warm and pleasant atmosphere.  
Thank you ladies for brightening up my day and helping me feel connected and safe.

title: Outstanding customer service.
body: After a recent health problem, which was attended to on the day, I returned to organise a repeat prescription, arrange to get some bloods taken and arrange a follow up consultation. Prescription was sorted out immediately, bloods were done in 5 minutes (immediately) and a consultation arranged within 48 hours for follow up (with a choice of male/female GP's). Work commitments prevented a quicker GP appointment.  The receptionist was simply outstanding in her conduct. All credit to this person and Queens Road Surgery as a whole, who in my opinion and experience have been simply outstanding at looking after their patients in an exemplary manner throughout these COVID-19 pandemic.

author: PB25
title: Excellent care
body: Care is excellent. Receive so much TLC and kindness. I have never experienced this level of care as a patient during a hospital stay.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: wezenkc85
title: Lack of care and compassion
body:
At the end of March my father took unwell and was admitted to Crosshouse as a result. He spent a bit longer than usual in the CAU because the hospital was very busy. The team there were great and my dad was very well looked after. My dad has chronic lung disease and suffered a tension pneumothorax requiring an emergency chest drain which had been traumatic and very painful. It had been a very scary experience.  
My dad was transferred to ward 5B one evening and you can imagine my horror when I received this text message:  
"I moved here at handover time and saw a daytime nurse who sat me in a seat next to my bed and said a night nurse would be along to help in a minute. Next nurse I saw was at 09:15 this morning. No meds, no sats, no care all night. No call button and calls for help ignored. Half extracted my drain trying to get into bed. Nightmare all round."My sister and I then couldn't get hold of dad and called the unit. My sister was greeted on the phone by a nurse who, when asked if our dad was on the ward, stated that they don't deal with chest drains. Trying to stay calm, my sister repeated that our father is on the ward? The nurse confirmed this but said they don't look after patients with chest drains so your dad was being transferred to the respiratory ward, 3B.From our telephone conversation it seemed to us that the lack of care and compassion my father had received overnight could be related to differing views on hospital policy, but unfortunately my dad was at the centre of this. We were very relieved when the staff in 3B took over dad's care and he was treated with the dignity and respect he deserves.

author: Juli68
title: Bad experience at emergency help
body:
I asked for help with heart pain and the risk of thrombosis. But then I saw that the receptionist wrote that I had pain in my legs. I felt very bad. I waited 4 hours!!! and left without going to the doctor. Then I found out that some people wait for 6 hours. This to me means that the medical care is not enough, and there are not enough medical personnel for the needs of the entire city. I think it is absolutely unacceptable for it to take so long, I feel it's a mockery of sick people. And why can't you just make an appointment for a certain time to the right specialist?  
In addition, the reception staff were very unfriendly, and even aggressive. When I approached them several times and wanted to say I didn’t feel well, they weren't listening to me. I wanted to find someone who has time to explain to me how everything works here, or a manager or administrator, they were told there was no one here and no one would help, and that I should go to my doctor. But my doctor referred me here.  
So, it was the worst experience I've ever had with the medical service. And I never got medical help, but I got a lot of indifference and rudeness.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

author: asteropeze84
title: Inadequate care on mental health ward
body:
I am writing this for my daughter who now lives with me. She became Ill with schizophrenia 9 years ago and it has been a difficult time to learn to live with this illness, understand it, try to recover and access the correct services for her.  
Although the staff are very helpful on this ward it is seriously understaffed, compared to some other wards I have found. There is a lack of privacy and some people like my daughter can spend years of their lives in a bed on a bay with five other patient and only a curtain for privacy Which is unbelievable as these patients are some of the most vulnerable in society. They have had to have their freedom taken away from them to keep them safe only to spend years locked up with no meaningful OT or rehabilitation services for them.  
This ward was only ever supposed to be a short term solution. I believe because the patients here have mental health illnesses they are put behind everyone else and as many of them don’t have a voice the trust can more easily ignore them. I have spent years visiting this ward and I do not feel it is a therapeutic environment. It seems more like a holding cell where people are medicated and put out again.  
As I said the staff are empathetic on the ward but I often wonder how they don’t burn out without more staff to be able to deliver adequate care. I think it’s depressing such wards still exist in 2022! The Ulster hospital has had major new builds throughout its grounds but I am not surprised, yet again, that the trust chooses to put these vulnerable and often very long term patients in the worst conditions. In my honest opinion it should have been knocked down many years ago.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Mercat
title: 5month old in a&e
body:
My 5 month old had taken ill and we were taken by ambulance to swah hospital in Enniskillen. I would like to make the following comments.  
1. On 4 separate occasions I was asked who was the emergency contact, their number and other paper work questions. This was by 4 different members of staff through triage etc. Should this not be streamlined - it seemed like a big waste of time.  
2. I observed other patients waiting, asking for a drink but never receiving one.  
3. I had a 5 month old in a&e breastfeeding. She was in pain, had temperatures and she needed care. I was there for approx 4 hours with no Calpol offered and stuck with all adults in a corridor. It wasn't until I paced back and forth at the nurses station with my screaming child did anyone really start taking me seriously. We were given Calpol and sent to paediatrics - where we should have been. A sick 5 month old should not be kept with sick adults.  
Thankful after a night stay she was on the mend and we were sent home.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: Caitlincee1
title: A positive experience during a difficult time
body:
I want to thank both doctors and nurses in A&E for providing me with quick treatment on a very busy Friday night.  
All staff on ward 6B, Bay A including Gastro Consultant who provided me with a high standard of care. I mainly want to thank Nurse Mairead who looked after me on the Saturday. Her empathy, compassion and patience towards me really made a difference. Nothing was too much and I honestly don’t know what I would have done without her. She put me at ease protected my dignity and supported me at a difficult time.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: cjandzara
title: Excellent care
body:
I had a bad start as I had to go to accident and emergency dept. at 3:00 am on Monday as I felt really unwell . They sent me for an x ray and found a blockage in my bowel only to send me home.  
I was then rushed to hospital on Wednesday morning where I was admitted for surgery and I can't praise the care I received enough from the surgical team led by Dr Proctor. I was then admitted to ward 44 where the treatment and care I receive was great. The staff could not do enough for me and I can't thank them enough.

author: Kboudou
title: Excellent urgent care
body:
Last Friday afternoon I got a call from my daughters school to say she had fallen and hurt her wrist.  
On my way to collect her, I rang Ards minor injuries. The nurse was very accommodating and told me to bring my daughter down an hour later.  
Ten minutes after our appointment time my daughter had been examined by Angela a nurse practitioner, and we were on our way to x-ray. The radiographer was very good and reassuring.  
An hour later my daughter was diagnosed with a fracture and we were leaving with a splint in situ and lots of information for what to do over the next 4-6 weeks.  
I was amazed at how quickly we had been treated and the professionalism and competence demonstrated by all the staff involved. Thank you all.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Ashcon
title: Caring, helpful and empathetic, it was a great experience
body: I recently gave birth to my 3rd son in SWAH (South West Acute Hospital) Enniskillen and just wanted to say all the staff in the Maternity and labour ward were brilliant. They are a credit to their profession. They were all so caring, helpful and empathetic, it was a great experience.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: polarisxs66
title: Let down by clinic
body: I feel let down by the clinic as I tried to have a coil fitted and they told me the wait for this is 8 weeks. They also had me request an STI kit through the post, but when I went to order it I was told the service is overwhelmed and that there are no tests.

author: empathytc56
title: Attending Fetal Assessment
body: Attending Fetal assessment is always something you do as a last resort. When I attended yesterday evening Joanne the midwife that greeted me was so kind, professional, personable & reassuring. I honestly felt so glad to meet her.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: L@83
title: Amazing service from my GP Practice
body: Would like to just pass on my thanks to my GP practice , Dr's MacDonald and Mitchell, at Port Glasgow Health Centre, for the amazing service delivered throughout the pandemic and after. I was always given either a telephone consultation or face to face appointment when needed and really appreciate the hard work of all the staff to ensure my needs were met.

author: Treesparrow
title: I was seen within minutes
body: Following a cat bite I contacted NHS 24. I was advised to attend the QEU hospital in Glasgow. Upon arrival at A and E I was logged in and directed to the Minor Injuries Unit. I was seen to within minutes, had a tetanus jag and was given antibiotics. Very efficient service. No more than 20 minutes between arrival and leaving. Hadn`t used the Minor Injuries unit before and it really was excellent.

author: buick29
title: My semi-annual diabetes blood test
body:
Arrived for my blood sample to be drawn at appointed time. (Crieff Community Hospital)  
was taken into the room by nurse Zoe, and after me explaining that " i was a difficult to get blood from person" Zoe thought she'd be in for a hard time, and so did i going by past experiences. zoe got everything prepared, sat down and took my arm, and started feeling for a vein, just as she was about to move to my other arm she said ahh here we go, she inserted the needle and bingo! she got blood from me at the first attempt!! well done Zoe, i am still in shock that she managed to do that, after many, many years of blood letting and all the hassles that came with it i have never ever had anyone get blood first time....except Zoe.  
[Very happy with 'Staff skills']

readBy.name: Perth and Kinross Health & Social Care Partnership

author: listenym86
title: I received exceptional care
body:
From the moment I arrived at the hospital with my extreme pain I received exceptional care. I was immediately given pain relief & was seen by consultant immediately after being diagnosed with a 9mm kidney stone. I received brilliant care from A&E nurses both male & female very supportive, radiographer Ellie, a brilliant urologist & my consultant Ms Bekarma. I never felt alone and I was moved to the assessment centre to await my operation in the morning to get a stent inserted into my kidney. Throughout my treatment I received brilliant attention to detail and I want to thank the NHS for all their hard work & dedication. I had never had a general anaesthetic so I was reassured by my anaesthetist what would happen this was excellent advice & calmed me down. I recovered in Ward 4 under the brilliant Care of Staff Nurse Young & her staff who worked tirelessly attending all their patients with great patience & expertise. I cannot thank everyone enough as I indeed was feeling awful but now on my way to a very good recovery before my next procedure.  
I have now received 3 appointments with Ms Bekarma the final one for laser treatment to the kidney stone this has been done in a timely manner & I feel I just had to write & add my great praise for all the staff who work for the NHS & Ayr Hospital - well done from a very grateful patient.

author: gifttk66
title: Professional and considerate ambulance crew
body: Lukasz and Laura were the ambulance crew that attended our home when my daughter became suddenly unwell as she was suffering from covid. They were polite, professional and considerate. They made my daughter feel at ease and reduced her anxiety whilst they treated her symptoms with care and attention. They communicated effectively with us regarding her condition and treatment options. This crew provided a lovely experience during an anxious time and are a credit to the NIAS, many thanks for their professionalism and care.

author: blueqd44
title: Implant removal and replacement
body: I went to the Stafford sex clinic today to have my implant removed and replaced. Nikki and Juliet were great and made me feel at ease and we’re making conversation with me to make sure I was okay and so I was distracted. Overall great experience :)

author: andromedaxq68
title: Needing a replacement coil
body: Lovely nurse on phone made me feel at ease but when she said i got to wait up to 3 months for my appointment thought was a bit ridiculous as iv been waiting for my 1st phone call for over 5 weeks already, as seemingly staff were always ill day before and it got cancelled.

author: Sc0rpi0
title: Incontinence problem
body: Community service continence nurses:  We had a visit from Fiona and Vicki to help my husband with an continence problem and we can’t thank them enough for all their help and support.  This has been a fairly long standing problem which has been made a lot easier by Fiona and Vicki’s advice and practical help in dealing with this matter.  It is an excellent service thanks to the NHS!

readBy.name: North Lanarkshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: AW09
title: The porter was so kind and helpful
body:
Would just like to say a massive thank you to Pat the porter. He took my dad for a scan back in December and left a lasting impression on my family, he was so kind and helpful. I work in the hospital and see Pat now and again, even after 6 months he asked me last week how my dad is getting on. That meant so much to me. I know he sees hundreds of patients every month.  
He always has a friendly face and a kind word to say, truly an asset to NHS Grampian!

author: Horsewoman
title: speech therapy assessment after head injury
body:
At the end of March this year my horse fell with me on a road near home and even though I was wearing a protective hat I ended up, amongst others, with 4 head fractures and two brain bleeds.  
I was in hospital for 4 weeks and even though I apparently communicated to some degree I am unable to remember anything about the first two weeks out of the 4.  
I woke up with my tongue having a strange feeling on the right side and the right side of my lip feeling a bit weak and having tingling, presumably from the right sided head fracture that I sustained in the fall. Also people reported that when I became tired I started to slur my speech, something that I did not notice when it happened but generally I went to bed early when I felt tired in the evenings.  
I was discharged back home with residual problems of dizziness and slightly impaired balance from this but I managed to look after my animals right from the start and together with my husband take my dog for walks almost daily.  
I was booked in with a physiotherapist a few times who treated my dizziness and after about 4 weeks a speech therapist and her student came for an assessment, I think because my slurred speech was mentioned.  
It took two weeks from the point the appointment was made for her to come and I think I had improved more during that time. She did not make a formal assessment but had a long chat with me during which she also had a look at my lateral tongue movement which was a bit slow. Thankfully she found me completely clear and intelligible and didn't think that I had any language problems, so apart from an offer to get in touch if I have problems and the advice that speaking is the best exercise for my speech muscles, nothing else is needed as far as she is concerned. She was very professional.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust
Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: Colsnell
title: Dislocated thumb after bike fall
body:
I hurt my thumb when I came off my bike and went to Stirling MIU to be seen. I’m on holiday up in Scotland so I didn’t know where things were.  
I was met by someone who just asked me what I needed and pointed me in the right direction (having asked me to sanitise my hands). So helpful as I have never been there before and was not fully focussed due to pain.I was told I may have a 3 hour wait to be seen. I heard him check up on me with reception as I was clearly in pain. He bought water to the people waiting. It’s a small gesture but really made a difference.It took around 3.5 hrs from walking in with a dislocated thumb in quite a bit of pain to walking out with a thumb in the right place in a splint with minimal pain. That is just amazing.Lovely staff took all my details and helped me find the proper address of the holiday home we were staying in. I only waited around 45 mins to be seen. The nurses talked through everything they were doing and gave me a full check up in case I’d hurt any thing else. I moved quickly to radiology and then back to MIU. The wait seemed short between each different service. They talked me through the problem, the pain relief options and helped me understand the different sensations so I knew that it had worked properly. My thumb didn’t want to pop back into place but there was no panic, no fluster just calm explanation and getting the job sorted as quickly and with as little pain as possible. Audrey and Kat were the main carers and they were just fantastic. Thank you so much. They put me at ease, made sure I was as comfortable as possible and really looked after me. I always felt I was in safe hands.I struggle to think how the service could be better.

author: Dignified
title: Dignity
body:
The first thing that comes to mind is Dignity. From then first time the nurses visited my Mother they treated her with the utmost dignity. They spoke directly to her and never asked us in the first instance how she was today. The nurses were always kind to my mother. It appears they always looked for any signs of pain or discomfort and wanted to advise us of the best course of action or, indeed, to call the GP if they thought necessary  
Nothing was too much trouble . They applied cream to Mother's legs and even held her hand at times. The nurses' priority was my mother but their approach to care ensured that the family felt comfort through their work.  
At a time when we felt despair the District Nursing Service was there to help and we will always be forever grateful

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Podiatry service
title: I honestly couldn't have been treated any better.
body:
The podiatrists were all friendly, helpful and attentive, meticulous and knowledgeable, offering good advice. I felt comfortable and at ease at all my appointments - it was a long healing process but I never felt under pressure or unduly worried as the podiatrists were very patient and understanding.  
I honestly couldn't have been treated any better.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Bobbobbob
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: IPS Employment Support
body:
I have had support from the IPS service at Nottinghamshire Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust on previous occasions to help me find work.  
In July 2021 Andrew became my new Employment Specialist as my previous employment ended due to COVID-19 and I needed to find a new job.  
Andrew created a new CV for me to highlight my skills and experience. We met weekly to apply for jobs and we found a role, through an employment agency, working for a supermarket as a part-time home delivery driver. This was exactly the type of role I wanted and Andrew checked carefully that this role was allowed under the permitted work arrangements of my benefits.  
I worked there up until the Christmas holiday, and unfortunately could not return due to a dispute between the supermarket and the agency.  
Andrew updated my CV to include my job at the supermarket, then supported me to start job searching again. We applied for a permanent part-time delivery driver role at a different supermarket and I was called to interview. Andrew helped me to prepare for the interview, and I was offered the job.  
My new employer asked for some documentation to prove my right to work, and Andrew helped me to scan and submit this for the pre-employment checks.  
I have now been working at my new job for around 5 weeks and I am really happy with the role. Andrew has continued to support me through my employment and there is an action plan and wellness plan in place to ensure that I am able to stay healthy and continue this job.  
I wouldn't have been able to do any of this without Andrew's support, as a lot of the processes were online.

author: blackbirdep36
title: How the Team have helped
body:
I’m a care worker who works with a young man who of late has been having some problems with how he has been interacting with some of our staff and other people in the larger community.  
I have known Tony for a long time since he was a community nurse. I have always rated him very highly in the job that he does. I also worked with Katie who shared her wealth of knowledge with the team. Helping to get some of the more difficult assessments done and arranging a lot of the meetings. The whole ICATT south team where very helpful and easy to talk to when I had to ring the office. It has been very easy working with ICATT and would definitely work with them again

author: Dazzl3
title: Poor experience at Bronglais General Hospital
body:
I had such a horrific experience at Bronglais Hospital last year that it has left me with ptsd.  
I was admitted late afternoon/early evening with scary heart symptoms. 111 had told me to get there urgently or call an ambulance but that us driving would be quicker.  
After being checked in and taken to the assessment area, the consultant basically saw everyone else but not me. I cried my heart out because it was on my son's birthday and we only had one car so my husband and disabled son had to sit in the car for hours not knowing if I was ok. I knew my son would be having meltdowns and quite distressed. I told the staff this and the nursing staff told the consultant but it didn't seem to matter. Eventually at midnight the next shift doctor arrived and looked after me. When I got out to my family my son was distraught and had had the worst birthday ever!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: romeocg97
title: Professionalism and dedication
body:
My mother stayed in ward 1a. We both found the staff upbeat, approachable and friendly. I was given regular updates on her general condition and rehabilitation. My main thanks go to the physios, Ryan and George in particular, who were friendly, supportive and encouraging.  
Mum is now back to what she was prior to her fall. I can also see her mood is getting better too.  
Thanks from the family for your professionalism and dedication so clearly see in your work, especially Aneka who was Mum's named nurse.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: recoveryispossible
title: Recovery is possible!
body:
I was drug and alcohol dependant for 34 years. I was drinking alcohol daily and injecting heroin and crack daily. I was also prescribed a very high dose of methadone. Every day was a struggle and I would wake up on a mission to get money to fund my use.  
My family were still in touch with me but the relationship was non existent due to my use.  
When my CGL worker would ask me how much I'm using I would always reply to her "how long is a peace of string".  
I knew I had to make some big changes as my health was in a bad way. My CGL worker got in touch with Stacy from the rehab program 'Offender to rehab' and they worked together to get me in to a rehab centre where I completed my detox and rehab program.  
I have been free from drug and alcohol dependency, for 42 days and that is an amazing achievement that I honestly never thought would be possible!  
I have now got my family, my health and my life back.  
There would be no way I would of been able to do this without my CGL worker Katy, she has been there for me through the whole process and never gave up on me and is still supporting me now.  
I am also really thankful to Stacy from west midland police who helped me gain access in to the rehab centre.  
Katy and Stacy have worked together to give me all the support I needed to get me through the journey  
I am so thankful for all the support I have received  
I hope that others can be inspired by my story and know that recovery is possible!

author: PRW64
title: I was blessed to be under their care
body:
The care and compassion of my speech and language therapist requesting I come back after noticing a change in my voice in a voice message, led her to identify that I had a stroke. She gently encouraged me to attend the Emergency Department, and from there to admission and throughout my lengthy time in hospital, the care, professionalism, compassion and kindness I experienced from staff in Altnagelvin wards 24 and 40 was fantastic.  
From domestic, auxiliary nurses, ward nurses, doctors, and not forgetting the patience of the ward manager :) I cannot praise them highly enough. They continued to reinforce that things would improve. Naturally I also would like to thank the neurology staff who helped me see light at the end of the tunnel and with whom I am currently engaged. Having identified something was not just right they have been diligent in offering me time and space to come to terms with potential changes .  
Furthermore the number of tests I undertook was amazing, all intended to give the clinical staff a steer in what I was encountering, and all those involved in carrying out those procedures, from the staff who took me to and from scans and x-rays to the staff who carried them out were exemplary.  
All those staff I encountered whilst working in challenging conditions , always had time for a word, to check, are you ok?, is there anything you need?, a smile, an acknowledgement of my situation, a reassurance. Saints everyone :) I was blessed to be under their care and my family and I would like to thank each and every one of them.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: Blessed78
title: Condition Management programme
body:
Rosalind is an amazing person and goes out of her way to help. She is an amazing help in every sense. She get's things done.  
Rosalind came along to help me volunteer and now I feel like I'm doing something good again. She has a wealth of knowledge in her field. What she does not know she is always willing to find out for you. I cannot thank Rosalind enough. I am blessed to have crossed paths with her.  
I will say it once again...She isAmazing! Keep being a light to others and thank you for all your help. Sad that our time has come to an end

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Grateful52
title: Positive experience of Condition Management
body: My experience with these services has been very positive.  The sessions gave me an opportunity to talk and express myself.  It helped me feel more relaxed with myself, and to think more positively about myself.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: sunzt59
title: Moving from drowning to swimming through therapy
body:
I had an uncontrollable breakdown at work. I felt overwhelmed by the pressure and completely hopeless.  
I had to leave. I didn't go back for five months.  
I stayed in bed most of the day getting up sometime before my evening meal. I couldn't be bothered to wash half the time and when I did finally get up I sat on the settee and watched telly before going back to bed.  
I couldn't bring myself to go out and I stopped my social life in fear of having a breakdown when I was out. I didnt even go in the garden. I felt...what is the point of me. (I I didn't feel suicidal but I did think if something happened to me and I died that'd be fine.  
I started therapy, which I I totally believed would be of no help at all!  
Well I was completely wrong. Yes it was hard and sometimes I felt felt over whelmed by the information. ( This was the first part of online webinars)  
Once I started the therapy and engaged with the tasks I began to come alive. I could feel the progress. Each task I tried to follow up as best as I could. I began not to cry every day. I do still cry but that's ok and it's not so so much these days and it's not daily.  
Working on stopping my unhelpful thought was great. I still have the sheet at home and one at work. I'm sure we all do it... Think we know what someone else is thinking. Now I tell myself I'm not a mind reader.  
I have a timetable (I know it doesn't work for everyone) I have put exercise on it for every day even if it is just a walk around the block or even the garden I try my best to do it. I don't beat myself up if I haven't, I refelected on what I have done over a week.  
Get a big task I need to do and avoiding it... This is now changed to making it achievable . Breaking it down to thd tiniest parts and then achieving one little step . That way you achieve all the time and begin to feel proud of the steps.  
I know it's not a miracle cure. I will keep checking in regulary, giving myself space to think about my achievements . I will add in more, extend my exercise time.  
I know im going forward.  
Take the plunge and begin to swim into life.

title: So helpful!
body: Needed a prescription urgently. It was totally my fault for not ordering in time. Despite it being half term and bank holiday they were so helpful and sorted within no time. Made such a difference to my holiday.

author: BB22
title: Fantastic staff
body: The staff in the day surgery ward were fantastic. They were very friendly and reassuring, everything was explained clearly to me and any questions I had were answered. They have an excellent level of professionalism and are a credit to the nhs.

title: Love the new manager
body: Wow. The new manager is amazing. I’ve spoken to her a few times and she really listens. I suggested a change at the surgery and within a few days she had implemented it. Well done and thank you

author: Inspired69
title: Absolutely incredible nurse
body:
Nurse Fiona was absolutely incredible. In the 5 years I have been attending the Cobridge clinic, I have never met somebody so knowledgeable, professional and highly skilled in everything she did or said.  
I came in with a cold sore and a genital wart, as well as for a full screening. I was terrified that I would get some kind of health complications down the line, and I was really hard on myself. But as soon as she confirmed my suspicions, she settled me right down. It was something about her energy that soothed the pain. She explained that a huge majority of people contract it through their lifetime, making (professional) jokes to lighten the mood. She was a joy to chat with, and I had never had such little pain/aftermath from somebody taking bloods.  
She had even explained, in depth, how I should do every single screening test. 5 years and not a single nurse had explained that I needed to put the first bit of pee into the urine cup! Just a month before, I had seen a different nurse, who accidentally left a bruise on my arm. I was terrified to have my bloods done at Cobridge again. But when Fiona did it, I didn't even feel it go in or out, and she even managed to talk to me during the blood taking.  
An absolutely inspiring woman! Get her a pay rise for her skills alone!

title: Kind and Caring
body: An appointment was arranged at 9am on a Monday following emergency treatment the Saturday before. The appointment was for the same afternoon—fantastic. A Stenographer carried out my leg scan very thoroughly and her assistant looked after me so well. Thank you.

author: jedimum04
title: Above and beyond
body:
My son contacted NHS24 after he injured his wrist while play fighting with a friend (he's 18 but boys will be boys!).  
We had seen the advice not to turn up at A&E unless it was a life threatening situation and despite being fairly sure his wrist was broken he called 111 and was given an appointment at the Borders General Hospital minor injuries clinic later that afternoon. He presented at A&E at the specified time and was seen very promptly by a nurse, who he says was one of the nicest people he has ever met (her name was Norma I believe). He struggles with anxiety but Norma put him completely at ease and within an hour and a half he had been examined, sent for an x-ray, diagnosed, put in plaster and sent on his way with pain relief, information and advice about self care and safe in the knowledge that a further appointment would come through in the next couple of weeks. This did happen and he was back having a further x-ray and a new cast fitted as the follow up showed damage to his scaphoid.  
The whole experience to date has been really good and I would recommend that calling NHS24 when you don't have a life threatening condition is far better than turning up at A&E and having to sit for a long period of time. The appointment system meant he was seen promptly and this hopefully also eased pressure on staff in A&E. Well done to everyone involved but a special mention to Norma who really went above and beyond in making my son comfortable and at ease during his visit.

title: Excellent help by receptionists
body: I called the practice to seek help in obtaining a Covid Vaccination Passport. I got straight through with no wait in queue and was given advice and assistance by a very, very helpful Receptionist. In a time when most reviews are negative, I felt compelled to leave a positive one and to thank all the staff, particularly on this occasion the Receptionist, at the practice for their continued help and advice.

title: Relaxed appointments
body:
Over the past few weeks attended for different issues and the team made me feel very relaxed even though I was really worried 

2 courses of different antibiotics 
Mini pill
Chest X-ray referral (back all clear)
Bloods taken
Smear
And prepping for coil to be fitted

I’m more relaxed now than I’ve been for months

title: Helpful Healthcare Assistant
body: The HA on a Tuesday morning is nothing short of excellent with her efficiency and oragnisational skills. There is never a time that I leave disappointed after seeing her, despite the reason for my visit. The HA is kind and confident in her role which allows for a better patient experience during what could be, an anxious time. Thank you !

author: funnygx88
title: Coil change
body:
Long wait for a coil change appointment but with all the referrals to this service it's not surprising!  
Dr Rocke and the nurse Juliet were fab, reassuring me and explaining what was happening throughout.

author: Grateful3
title: Wonderful staff
body: My Mum had a car accident and required to be checked at ED as she bumped her head and was a little disorientated at the scene. She was seen quickly, observations taken and monitored, information given and was discharged. She is well I am pleased to say. All of this happened so smoothly but the biggest element for my Mum was the kindness shown to her by the receptionist, triage nurses and medical staff. Their calmness, empathy, time taken to explain things and humour took away any stress and shock she had. She wanted me to pass on how wonderful staff were.

author: Shohf84
title: Safe in their hands
body:
Dr Dhillon and the orthopaedic team at Cannock Chase Hospital are extremely professional and caring. I felt looked after and safe in their hands following a procedure under general anaesthetic, and wouldn’t have wanted to be looked after by anyone else.  
A big thank you to everyone that looked after me.

author: Rosa c
title: I was looked after well
body:
I had been booked in for breast surgery (cancer).  
I only have praise for the nurses looking after me while I waited and observed a compassionate attitude towards those who had returned from theatre  
My nerves were calmed and I felt I was in good hands .  
The doctor & nurses in theatre helped me feel relaxed and again I felt I was being well cared for considering I was fully awake as my heart condition prevented me from having General anaesthetic .  
All went smoothly and I was returned to the area I originally was where again I was looked after well  
I only have praise for them all during this particular experience. Thank you

author: Grateful52
title: Practical and knowledgeable community nurse
body:
My sister, 71 years old, fit and healthy, never sick in her life, took a pain in her back which turned out to be metastasis from a primary tumour in her lung. It turned out there were several other tumours.  
After the initial diagnosis the pain was very intense and morphine was commenced quickly. Our GP surgery doctors were very attentive, the pharmacy delivered her numerous medicines. Beds, chairs, mattresses were all delivered quickly.  
Our community nurse, Sionagh, was an incredible support, very practical and knowledgeable.  
During the nine months my sister lived with me there were many setbacks which were difficult to overcome. Sionagh was amazing. As my sister deteriorated she went far beyond the call of duty, calling several times a day. Her care, her manner, her empathy was exceptional. I will never forget her. I call her my best friend forever

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Wonderful service and support
body:
Emergency phone call at 3am. Team arrived very quickly and immediately assed the situation and commenced treatment whilst also giving much needed support to the family.
Everything was done with kindness and professionalism and without this the successful outcome could have been much different.
Thanks again and please pass my admiration on to the crew.

title: Fantastic care and service
body: My Doctor at Woodlands Surgery has been excellent. Caring and professional. Would highly recommend this surgery.

author: Mar1954
title: We are so thankful with the health care Mum has received
body:
Our Mother had ongoing chest infection and had received 4 oral antibiotics over several weeks from her GP who always give Mum exceptional care.  
Her oxygen levels went low and required oxygen therapy for a short time resulting in needing the Hospital at home team. This meant Mum could be in her own home and still receive acute hospital care.  
Dr Khan and the nursing team visited Mum over 5 days, where she received intravenous antibiotics, nebuliser and oxygen therapy as needed.  
A referral was made to SALT due to Mum having increased coughing to assess her swallow.  
Mums medications were also reviewed by Rory the pharmacist and Dr Khan which has really helped.  
We are so thankful with the health care Mum has received from the Medical Practice and the Hospital at home team over the last month.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

links.id: very well looked after and cared for

title: Brilliant Reception Staff
body:
I have phoned the practice twice this month and on both occasions my queries were dealt with very efficiently and in a polite & friendly way by the receptionist.
 My first call was to book in a contraceptive depot. The receptionist was able to advise me the date it was required and booked me in at a acceptable date & time. I also enquired about a physio self referral and was booked in for the following working day. Great service! The physio was very thorough & informative too.
My second call was to ask about my COVID travel pass, i needed to change my surname as my passport was in my maiden name. The receptionist changed it straight away and wished me a good holiday! Really happy with the service

title: Good practice
body:
Staff are extremely helpful and friendly.
There is opportunity during consultations to discuss the treatment offered to you.
Staff make you feel comfortable during appointments.

author: Zachary19
title: Great care on the ward
body:
First day after my operation a nurse who cared for me and stayed with me a lot was amazing you could not wish to be in any safer hands. At the end of the day she came with me when I was transferred to Hilton main ward. Also came to see me on the ward a couple of days later before I went home.  
If I ever had to go into hospital again I would be more than happy to go back to the same wards with the same staff.

title: Super Treatment
body: I visited A&E Evesham on a Saturday, early afternoon, was seen and treated really quickly by a kind, caring nurse. She put me at ease straight away and even went outside to the car to ask and explain to my partner why I needed to go on to another hospital. What a wonderful hospital we have in Evesham.

author: Jmc67
title: Appreciated as a person
body:
Knowledgeable, friendly and understanding health and care services. They allowed me to express my difficulties on a daily basis and how to manage them more efficiently. I was treated with dignity regarding health issues to employment concerns.  
It has helped me feel more appreciated as a person rather than being ignored, gaining more knowledge and support in my recovery from a brain injury, stroke with depression, and anxiety, at a time when I needed the support the most.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Carrie Jane
title: Daughter being transferred between hospitals
body: Our daughter took a major seizure and was rushed to Altnagelvin Hospital, when in resus she had a further 6 seizures, the only option left was to put her under anaesthetic to let her body rest and stop her seizing. She then had to be transferred to PICU in the Royal Hospital for Sick Children in Belfast, where she then was put on a ventilator and a lot of other machines to keep her condition stable. After 2 days in RVH she was then able to be transferred back to Altnagelvin as she no longer required Intensive Care and so she could be closer to home. Natasha and Alison who transferred her were amazing and helped us feel so at ease in such a difficult time, we knew our daughter was in safe hands. We will be eternally grateful for all the staff as our daughter wouldn’t be here today without them.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust
Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Lovely efficient staff
body: I could not fault my last visit to Longsight Medical Practiice. I don't think the surgery has ever been as good as it is now. The health professional I saw was very professional and thorough. The reception staff were great too.  It is also great news the surgery is now re-introducing advanced appointments for non-urgent / routine treatment. This way I can make an appointment outside work hours. Same day appointments are great if you need that service, but if you don't it's not a great idea. Clearly the surgery are listening to patients.

title: Great Service
body:
I have always been impressed with all staff at Southam Surgery - friendly, professional and can always get an appointment. All my family are members and the same is true for them. Telephone appointments work well for me as I live and work away from home.
I can unreservedly recommend.

title: Amazing service
body: Having woken up with symptoms of cystitis (sadly a regular complaint) I rang the surgery and within less than an hour spoke to both a nurse and a GP agreed next steps and likely treatment. Amazing service with a long bank holiday looming. Thank you so much.

author: Pop Poppy
title: Treated with compassion, politeness and sincerity
body: In 2019 I was diagnosed operated on for bowel cancer which was a huge shock. I was operated on by a surgeon called Mr Rathore the operation although very risky due to being overweight, high blood pressure and being a Diabetic grade 2 was very successful and I’m pleased to be here to share my story. The impact of it turned me into an emotional wreck, it was like a train crash. The last three years have been journey of pain, emotion and a real struggle to accept the fact of a Stoma Bag being fitted. It was the first time in my life I had any medical issue and it hit me like a train. 3 years on my pain is being manage well and the stoma bag is not as scary as I initially predicted and I have fully accepted it as a small price to pay for my life. Whilst in hospital I was treated from surgeons down to the ladies who served dinner with compassion, politeness and sincerity, and for this I truly thank them. In particular the Stoma nurses Fliss, Michelle, Deborah and Sally who have been remarkable through out.

author: Cleo7
title: Poor hospital treatment and discharge arrangements
body:
I was admitted to ward 5 with a serious bacterial infection after antibiotics course from GP failed to improve. On arrival a staff member recognised me from a mental health service and announced this to other staff in front of me, breaching my confidentiality. I have no current mental health concerns and used the service 3 years ago.  
The care team then focused on this rather than my physical health problem. They denied I had this infection , refused to treat me with antibiotics, gave me one bag of fluids.  
On the morning they discharged me, I awoke in a bed full of diarrhoea - information the night staff did not pass on. The senior doctor who came to see me I found to be extremely rude, suggesting I needed a psychiatry referral. When I questioned them it was clear they hadn’t read my notes to see the name of the infection I had. They said I was fit to be discharged even though I now had faecal incontinence, a catheter due to not being able to urinate and I couldn’t keep anything down. They suggested the infection was made up because I had previously 3 years ago had a mental health issue and I was fit to be discharged.  
I left even though I could barely walk. I am at home in bed with a catheter and an infection still working it’s way around my body.

readBy.name: Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Great practice  , caring doctors
body: I find these doctors at this practice very knowledgeable and actually care about their patients. Doctors actually talk to you and discuss treatments.I have had follow up calls from a doctor out the blue to see how I was a week after my visit to make sure the medication was working and my problem was getting better, which it was. It kinda blew me away as never had this good a treatment from any practice before. The nurses are very good as well and receptionist are also good, so the whole package at shipdham surgery is the best .

title: 5 star service
body: I was very nervous about having a cystoscopy however the staff were so lovely .They took time reassuring me and explaining the whole procedure before and whilst it was being done.  The Dr who performed it was very gentle  and  I didn't really feel a thing .5 star service .

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent practice
body: My thanks and appreciation to all Dorking team at Hillside and New house surgeries for dealing with my problem so quickly and getting medication to me before the bank holiday shut down. Great team work 🌟

author: NameName
title: Excellent mental health support
body: I have met Dr Smith on several occasions over the past few years. He has always provided excellent, down-to-earth, compassionate support. I have really appreciated his honesty, and warm and thoughtful communication style - and especially his willingness to talk about unknowns and grey areas in psychiatry, which I have taken as a sign of genuine respect for my intelligence and my dignity. On each occasion, Dr Smith has given the impression that he is as open to listening and learning as I am - and that has been great!

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Great service from security on main reception
body:
On arrival at the main entrance for a routine X-ray, I was extremely short of breath. The security guard saw me struggling and immediately came to my aid. He found me a wheelchair and took me to the Minor Injuries Unit where I was seen promptly. The security guard remained extremely calm, made no fuss, and reassured me telling me what he planned to do at all times.

The service provided by the security guard was second to none. I highly commend him and his awareness of the needs of patients entering and leaving the hospital.

author: Melter
title: I felt very exposed to COVID
body: I was unceremoniously handed the liquid to drink, and had to remove my mask and sit in an open corridor drinking for an hour. I felt very exposed to covid and the waiting area was dark and grim

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: Super Minor Surgery dept at the Willows
body: I have attended the Minor Surgery many times over the past few years except of course through Covid.  The Ladies are really lovely they make you very welcome and they do a really good job.  I would not hesitate to recommend them for any minor surgery and would not hesitate to visit them  again.

title: Excellent service
body:
I have been a patient at this practice for many years and have always found the staff and GPs to be professional & very helpful. 
Like all practices they have been under extreme pressure over recent years but they have managed to maintain a very high standard.
In summary, a great practice with friendly, professional staff.

author: Valerie46
title: Knee Replacement
body:
From the moment I arrived everyone was really kind and supportive - kindness itself. Taken to a room to have all my information checked with no rush. It may have been routine for the nursing staff but it was done very well and caring.  
I was visited by doctors, anaesthetist, then taken to the pre op room again. Everyone was so nice and jolly which is what you want at the time. I had my operation and was taken up to the recovery ward - again very caring. It was all so smooth and well done. I was taken on the ward where the nursing staff were wonderful on the days I was there, so professional and no dreary faces. Nothing was to much trouble. Everyone at Cannock Chase Hospital should be proud of what they have accomplished. Thank you to everyone for making my stay so stress free

author: waltzjz66
title: I didn't know where I was and how to get home
body: My mental health took a turn for the worse a few months ago and I took an overdose, I was told my blood test was ok and I can go home ,I was new to living in the Borders and I didn't know where I was and how to get home, it eventually cost me a significant amount in a taxi fare to get myself home, which I can't afford due to being medically retired, I had to cut back on food and heating because of this. I was simply told by NHS Borders that that's their policy.

author: songthrushhe47
title: Kind and caring staff
body: Nikki and Juliet were very kind and caring during my implant removal and kept me feeling calm

title: A Fantastic Experience
body:
I was extremely worried and anxious about having an Endoscopy and Colonoscopy, however, as I arrived at the Endoscopy department of the Luton and Dunstable Hospital I was greeted by a receptionist, was polite, informative, and made me feel at ease straight away.

I was then prepared by a Nurse, who talked me through what was going to happen that afternoon, and she was very in depth, allowing me to ask questions, and putting me at ease, she covered all bases, and I left with all the information that I needed to know for my procedure.

The Nurse was very competent, polite, and put my mind at ease by giving me all the information that I required about the procedures, their processes, and the results at the end.

I was then allowed to get change in a clean area, with fresh clean hospital shorts, gown, and dressing gown.

I was then collected by another Nurse, who was amazing, she straight away made me feel like everything was going to be ok.

She advised me around pain relief, cannular, the procedures, she introduced me to the doctor, and the other Nurse that would be helping me, she was a calming professional, and  made me feel very comfortable, talking me all the way through the Endoscopy and Colonoscopy, what was happening and why.

I felt reassured, calm, and was feeling very comfortable with the way the Nurses and doctor treated me, with respect, dignity, and professionalism.

I was informed of all the different observations, and my mind was put at ease.

After the procedures, I was taken to the recovery Ward, and another Nurse, once again kind, polite and very professional, did all her checks and I was then allowed to prepare for discharge.

A young nurse kindly gave me tea and biscuits followed by discharge by another Nurse, who went through all the relevant the paperwork in a calm, professional and polite way, told me what the doctors had found via the procedures, and I was informed nothing sinister was discovered which gave me a great a relief and happiness, as I was very worried that it may turn out to be something dangerous.

I thanked the nurses and overall my personal experience was amazing, I could not fault it from start to finish.

All of the staff are assets to the organisation.

I am thankful to you all.

title: The NHS at its best
body: After a GP referral to Gynaecology, I was seen within 3weeks. The treatment I received was amazing, the staff across the board were professional, courteous, and reassuring, given I was so nervous. I was advised of what to expect during and after the procedures. Thank you so much.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing practice
body:
My GP surgery is awsome.
They are always busy but do everything to help you at all times. I know how busy they are and I appreciate everything they do they go beyond just being receptionist or managers. Anything they can do to help is done. It's never a problem and they always always give u an appointment if possible or give u a call from my GP.i would like to give a special thanks to all the receptionist staff for all there help when I am poorly. I know they get verbally abused on the phone but people don't realise if they could give you an appointment they would in a heart beat. You are all amazing and I would like to thank you all again. All reception staff all GPS at Bridge Road medical Centre should be given a medal 🏅 for there hard work help and kindness to all they help. Thank you Sonya Felmingham

author: TorTor
title: Baby's 6-9 month review
body:
I'm a first time mum and was attending my 6-9 month review with baby. It was not a very enjoyable experience. It felt like it was a check list of questions and if you didn't say yes you were doing something wrong. There was no conversation around how things were going, instead it was how things were a "bad habit" or impractical advice.  
It wasn't very baby led at all. When I tried to share any queries it seemed like they didn't want to know. I was directed to ask the doctor. Not much help when you can't get speaking to a doctor unless it's an emergency.  
When asked about my mental health, there was a big emphasis on how what I said had to be written down and how my main health visitor might need to call me, as if I was saying something wrong. It wasn't enjoyable or supportive, but instead felt so clinical and like a tick box exercise.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Good Practice
body: I find the the whole team, the receptionist, nurse practitioner, helpful, kind , considerate abd professional

title: Excellent patient care
body: I saw the doctor about a number of issues all of which they resolved with great patience and understanding. I left the surgery feeling that I had had a chance to ask any questions that I wanted and with all the medicines and advice I needed to manage my medical conditions.

title: Excellent practice
body:
The helpful team at this practice are friendly and efficient. My recent visits have been conducted so thoroughly by the doctor I felt it warranted completing this form. 
I was impressed that 4 student doctors were involved during 4 of my appointments and I noticed their confidence grew during their period of training.
Having some services available on site helps considerably, especially a Physiotherapist and also Practice Nurses who have attended to me both at the Medical Centre and at home during an emergency.
These are the services I have benefited from but in  Reception there are notices offering many kinds of Support Groups if required.
Having decent services available locally at the Medical Centre means so much to people of my age (87) or indeed, of any age.

title: Indifferent
body: Yesterday I was lucky to get an appointment with a doctor generally you can't but yesterday I did and I spoke to a young female doctor and felt I was being listened too and I was treated well,she left me feeling like she cared good for her we need more like her I was well impressed.

title: Friendly and confident
body: I had surgery at Bridgend clinic and the staff are so very friendly and helpful, put me at ease. The practitioners through to discharge gave me information throughout. This is an excellent way to reduce the backlog and help people to see again.

title: Absolutely fantastic!
body:
The team at Quedgeley Medical Centre are wonderful. The reception team are always really helpful when booking appointments and for another enquiries. 
The doctor we see is truly amazing with my children particularly my daughter who frequently has respiratory issues. She is always seen quickly and he is always so thorough and helpful in providing both treatment and reassurance. Nothing is ever too much trouble for him and I feel he really deserves to be acknowledged for the care he and others there provide!

title: Very efficient surgery
body: Over last 2 years, cant fault anything with this practise, always able to make appointment, email for advise on medications with rapid response and see a GP face to face.     Staff always pleasant and would like to praise the NHS in all areas as well as surgery staff.  Thank you.

author: Lorraine22
title: Great staff in the endoscopy unit
body: Staff were great with me from moment I arrived to the moment I left. I was also checked on regularly to.

readBy.name: Office of Joe Fitzpatrick, MSP for Dundee City West

title: A visit to the SHC
body: The doctors and nurses at the Telford s.h.c are all angel's and I love them all

Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: lacertajq89
title: Stress echocardiography
body: Attended for my echocardiogram,the staff who looked after me were absolutely fantastic. What a wonderful team you have Dr Glen greatest respect and good wishes to you all.

author: Joise
title: The staff really couldn’t have been more helpful and approachable.
body:
Having now delivered both my daughter and son at the PRM Glasgow. Unfortunately my first experience wasn’t great. I have had sometime to reflect on my experience in May 2022.  
The staff where incredible from entering the hospital on the morning of my elective section. I would like to say a special thanks to the anaesthetist in particular. He went over and above to make me feel calm and relaxed during my surgery. He was keeping myself and my husband up to date with the procedure at every stage. I just found him to be really nice and made the whole experience extremely positive.  
The midwives and any other staff I was in contact with really couldn’t have been more helpful and approachable. Well done PRM. Thanks again for bringing my two children into this world and caring for them and I.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: waltzjz66
title: Comments made by staff
body: Ambulance staff stated there is nothing wrong with my mobility, even though I have excruciating pain everydayI phoned the Scottish ambulance patient transport for assistance in taking me to an appointment, as I have fibromyalgia, arthritis and nerve damage which going by public transport would make my pain worse, the call handler stated a previous pick up by patient ambulance staff, a staff member had said there is nothing wrong with my mobility. I got very upset by this.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Hip patient
title: Emergency surgical admission
body:
I contacted NHS 24 as had I sudden acute abdominal pain. They were amazing. They quickly and efficiently arranged an appointment at Stobhill out of hours service. The on-call doctor very quickly recognised how unwell I was. She was efficient, kind and reassuring. I was referred to surgical assessment at QUEH. The nurses and medical staff were amazing!! They were so concerned about my well being. The ANP responsible for my care deserves a special mention for being so efficient and caring Again everyone was so capable, professional and kind.  
Then I was admitted to ward 9B. Every member of staff I met was kind, courteous and professional. Senior Charge Nurse Kimmett should be proud of her very efficient department and the staff who work there.  
I also need to mention the team in the x-ray dept where I had several investigations. A very busy department, but every team member was concerned for my well being and tried hard to keep me comfortable. Two consultant surgeons were responsible for my care. Mr Park & Mr Alani both made me feel that I was in kind, capable hands and really had my best interests at the core of the care I received.  
I would like to thank every one who dealt with me. Each team member makes the NHS an amazing place.

author: Emmgh49
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The quality of care on this ward is amazing
body:
The quality of care I have been receiving on this ward is amazing. I’m so thankful for everything the staff on this ward have been doing for me, their ability to provide care to patients is very good. They always communicate in a clear, honest and straightforward way which I really appreciate.  
The food on the ward has been very nice, I really enjoy the breakfast, the toast and porridge the girls make is lovely. The cleanliness of the ward is very good also, the cleaners are well trained and know what they’re doing.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent service
body: Always a positive experience dealing with Bentham Rd practice ecen in difficult circumstances.  Kind, courteous reception staff who go above and beyond to assist, efficient staff on the prescription line and reasuring and compassionate clinical staff. We have had nothing but praise for the whole team. Thank you for all you do.

author: V1rg086
title: Why is this procedure so downplayed?
body:
I started writing this from my bed at late at night having just had my first Hysteroscopy this afternoon. Over 48hrs after now & need to tell my story. I do not want to scare anyone but my story is not unique and I don’t wish this experience on anyone. It should not be allowed to happen in 2022.  
I am in my mid thirties (no kids) & spent the last 1 year+ having appointments and investigations for bleeding between excruciating, heavy periods. The past year was full of issues with missing referrals, and then my pathway documents being lost by the hospital.  
I spent much time on the phone chasing up on my care the past year and already had little trust in the clinic (Salford Royal Gynae with it’s peeling walls, mismatched chairs, underfunded aesthetic). I was glad to be going in to remove what was likely a 2cm benign polyp & was hopeful this hysteroscopy would be the final simple procedure. When I finally received my pamphlet (the day before!) it was like the advice I had read online from healthcare professionals. It advised to take the pain relief before, that I might experience cramp like pains, I can go straight back to work, recovery 1-2 days if biopsy is taken. I feel it was grossly downplayed! I turned up alone (mistake), gave a urine sample and sat in a waiting room to listen to the radio. I was feeling a bit nervous never having had a hysteroscopy before but the nurse who came to walk me into the room seemed happy and breezy. I thought... can’t be too bad. I entered the room which looked like a large doctors office but with a stirrup chair, curtains and lots of equipment around it. I was telling myself, surely something done in this environment cannot be that bad. The Dr was lovely and chatty, read through a form and I signed. They said I could have a local anaesthetic to the cervix and even though I said oh I’m absolutely fine with injections/dentists, have a high pain threshold etc they firmly stated that it would likely be more painful having the injection than just going through it (alarm bells!). I was then asked by a 2nd nurse to change behind a curtain to put on a gown then straight into the chair to be positioned. My heart started racing at this point (natural I thought) and then all of a sudden the doctor was talking, cleaning the outside, a speculum went in then cleaning the inside. All the time the 2 nurses were asking me questions and I was chatting nervously away making jokes and then it happened. The next part is burned into my brain moment by moment. I wanted to scream & cry looking up at the illustrations on the ceiling (I never ever want to see the book they were from anywhere again). I tried to keep talking sentences but I couldn’t, I couldn’t breathe, I felt out of body at times. I remember looking at the screen and forcing myself to try and listen to what they were saying while I felt every movement, a pain I can’t even describe (I’ve had to have morphine in the past for painful injuries and this pain was even higher than those incidences). The Dr said the polyp was a mix with a fibroid and I could see it was large (in the space between my left and right tube) they asked if they could try take more away & I couldn’t believe this was even suggested! I said no please stop. When I was told it was over I was shaking, cold, shivery & hot at the same time. I joked about not being able to stand up when I was left to get myself off the bed & felt I might vomit. Once changed they sat me down & I signed a form for a general anesthetic (shaking throughout). I was in a state of shock for the next few hours. I sat in the post procedure waiting room where you are left & forgotten about with your hot drink & biscuit, phoned my family, chatting away about it all in a false it was horrible but hey ho voice. Then tried to walk to the pharmacy & was shocked to find I could only shuffle to pick up 2 medications for my periods before the GA. I feel people should be advised they must bring someone with them, I’m a fitness fanatic and this shocked me to feel so weak. Also, this is the first time since I raised my symptoms over a year ago that I have been offered any medication). Every step was agony in my womb, taking my breath away, I had to keep stopping. The taxi home, every bump was agony & I’m still in pain today & bleeding (again had been given misinformation that it’s just a little spotting) and can’t walk properly.I don't think even 1 single woman should be made to to go through this procedure awake! It's quite simply barbaric. The worst part; I feel like I felt when I was raped by a "nice" man when I was younger. Especially as I now believe that one of the likely reasons for the Dr and his assistants being so nice and chatty was because they are fully aware of the indescribable pain this procedure can cause women. I spent that evening awake at midnight crying hysterically having flashbacks of what happened. This is not like me. Why did everyone seem so nonchalant during the procedure? I know they are trying to keep you calm but I find it impossible they are not aware that this was trauma pain, I must have been white as a sheet and shaking, why was my blood pressure/heart rate not monitored? Where was the gas & air that you get in A&E? Why is it so downplayed and why are women expected to bear this! I have since read hundreds of stories of other women saying it’s worse than childbirth & even a campaign to end painful Hysteroscopies entirely. I want people to know that they can demand a General Anaesthetic if they have to!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
